publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3933# Alasdair Morgan: Wanlockhead Museum Trust and Museum of Lead Mining—That the Parliament notes that 2006 is the 250th anniversary of the founding of Wanlockhead Miners’ Library, established by the lead miners as part of their educational and cultural activity and now under the care of the Wanlockhead Museum Trust; recognises that the award-winning museum itself is a unique monument to industrial workers in the Lowther Hills, as well as being a valuable economic asset to today’s economy, and believes that the Scottish Executive should act to ensure that arrangements are in place so that the museum’s trustees can plan for the future with some degree of certainty instead of encountering the intermittent financial uncertainty which, on occasion, threatens the very existence of the museum.

S2M-3933# Wanlockhead Museum Trust and Museum of Lead Mining (lodged on 7 February 2006) Alex Neil*, Alex Fergusson*, Rob Gibson*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Jim Mather*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Fergus Ewing*, Brian Adam*, Mr John Swinney*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Christine Grahame*, Colin Fox*
S2M-3933# Wanlockhead Museum Trust and Museum of Lead Mining (lodged on 7 February 2006) Robin Harper*, Chris Ballance*, Murray Tosh*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3933# Alasdair Morgan: Wanlockhead Museum Trust and Museum of Lead Mining—That the Parliament notes that 2006 is the 250th anniversary of the founding of Wanlockhead Miners’ Library, established by the lead miners as part of their educational and cultural activity and now under the care of the Wanlockhead Museum Trust; recognises that the award-winning museum itself is a unique monument to industrial workers in the Lowther Hills, as well as being a valuable economic asset to today’s economy, and believes that the Scottish Executive should act to ensure that arrangements are in place so that the museum’s trustees can plan for the future with some degree of certainty instead of encountering the intermittent financial uncertainty which, on occasion, threatens the very existence of the museum. Supported by: Alex Neil, Alex Fergusson, Rob Gibson, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Andrew Welsh, Jim Mather, Eleanor Scott, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Richard Lochhead, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Adam Ingram, Fergus Ewing, Brian Adam, Mr John Swinney, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Christine Grahame, Colin Fox, Robin Harper, Chris Ballance, Murray Tosh, Donald Gorrie
S2M-3933# Wanlockhead Museum Trust and Museum of Lead Mining (lodged on 7 February 2006) Frances Curran*, Mr David Davidson*
S2M-3933# Wanlockhead Museum Trust and Museum of Lead Mining (lodged on 7 February 2006) Michael Matheson*

S2M-3933# Alasdair Morgan: Wanlockhead Museum Trust and Museum of Lead Mining—That the Parliament notes that 2006 is the 250th anniversary of the founding of Wanlockhead Miners’ Library, established by the lead miners as part of their educational and cultural activity and now under the care of the Wanlockhead Museum Trust; recognises that the award-winning museum itself is a unique monument to industrial workers in the Lowther Hills, as well as being a valuable economic asset to today’s economy, and believes that the Scottish Executive should act to ensure that arrangements are in place so that the museum’s trustees can plan for the future with some degree of certainty instead of encountering the intermittent financial uncertainty which, on occasion, threatens the very existence of the museum. Supported by: Alex Neil, Alex Fergusson, Rob Gibson, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Andrew Welsh, Jim Mather, Eleanor Scott, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Adam Ingram, Fergus Ewing, Brian Adam, Mr John Swinney, Christine Grahame, Colin Fox, Robin Harper, Chris Ballance, Murray Tosh, Donald Gorrie, Frances Curran, Mr David Davidson, Michael Matheson, John Swinburne Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-3933# Wanlockhead Museum Trust and Museum of Lead Mining (lodged on 7 February 2006) Roseanna Cunningham* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
